Specific Details: Letter to Darren O'Rourke TD suggesting a parliamentary question to Minister Eamon Ryan regarding the introduction of specific packaging format / product targets as committed to in the Waste Action Plan for a Circular Economy and emphasising the need for a commitment to introducing specific packaging recovery and recycling targets for materials outside the scope of the DRS.
Subject Matter: Letter to Darren O'Rourke TD suggesting a parliamentary question to Minister Eamon Ryan regarding the introduction of specific packaging format / product targets as committed to in the Waste Action Plan for a Circular Economy and emphasising the need for a commitment to introducing specific packaging recovery and recycling targets for materials outside the scope of the DRS.
Intended Results: 1 - To highlight the need for the introduction of targets regarding collection and recycling of specific materials including beverage cartons as committed to in the Waste Action Plan for Circular Economy. 2 - To get an update from Minister Eamon Ryan on the status of the introduction of these targets. 3 - To encourage Sinn Féin to support the introduction of specific packaging recovery and recycling targets for materials outside the scope of the DRS such as cartons.
Client(s): Alliance for Beverage Cartons and the Environment, Ireland - ACE Ireland|ACE Ireland, c/o Instinctif Partners, The Greenway, Ardilaun Court (Block C), 112 – 114 St. Stephen’s Green, Dublin, D02 TD28|aceireland@instinctif.com|+353 (0)1 588 0866

Specific Details: Meeting with Sinn Féin's Spokesperson on Environment and Climate Action, to discuss the need for a ‘mixed technology’ approach to decarbonisation for rural Ireland.
Subject Matter: Meeting with Sinn Féin's Spokesperson on Environment and Climate Action, to discuss the need for a ‘mixed technology’ approach to decarbonisation for rural Ireland.
Intended Results: To highlight the need for a ‘mixed technology’ policy approach to decarbonisation which ensures choice and affordability for rural off natural gas grid households and businesses by embracing the benefits of lower carbon and cleaner liquid gas (LPG) as well as renewable liquid gas (BioLPG and rDME).

Lobbyist Name: Starrus Eco Holdings, a subsidary of Beauparc Utiliites
Specific Details: Discussion on the Joint Oireachtas committee report on the circular economy
DPOs Lobbied: Darren O'Rourke|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Richard Bruton|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Discussion on the Joint Oireachtas committee report on the circular economy
Intended Results: Provide clarity on the role of private sector waste collectors, describe benefits of current waste management system (including investments to date), update members of the progress of the IWMA's recycling task force and provide details of future investment pipeline. Also to explain the limitations of our industry to recycle non recyclable materials and the need for more focus on upstream design and material selection for products and packaging.
Lobbying Activities: Two separate 30 minute meetings with two members of the JOC to discuss the recommendations of the JOC report and provide details of Beauparc's investment strategy.|Meeting|2-5
